title: Youth injured in shooting at Thirappane
byline: A person has been injured and hospitalized after being shot by an unidentified gunman in the Galkulama area of Thirappane, Anuradhapura.

title: Trump says US to hold nuclear talks with Iran next week
byline: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Wednesday he would likely seek a commitment from Iran to end its nuclear ambitions at talks next week and credited U.S. strikes on Iran with bringing a swift end to the war between Israel and Tehran.

title: Showers expected in several areas today
byline: Showers will occur at times in the Western, Sabaragamuwa and North-western provinces and in Nuwara-Eliya, Kandy, Galle and Matara districts, the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Mass shooting in gang-plagued Mexican state leaves 11 dead and more injured
byline: At least 11 people were killed, including a teenager, and more wounded in a Tuesday night shooting in the central Mexican city of Irapuato, authorities said on Wednesday.

title: 32 senior police officers, including 9 DIGs, transferred with immediate effect
byline: Thirty-two senior police officers, including nine Deputy Inspector Generals (DIGs) and 16 Senior Superintendents of Police (SSPs), have been transferred with immediate effect.

title: Discussion held between Sri Lanka’s Foreign Minister and Iranian Ambassador
byline: A discussion has been held between the Iranian Ambassador to Sri Lanka, Dr. Alireza Delkhosh, and the Minister of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment, and Tourism, Vijitha Herath.

title: One critically injured after container truck overturns onto three-wheeler
byline: A person has been injured and hospitalized after an accident occurred at around 1.30 a.m. today (26) in the Orugodawatta area, when a container truck overturned onto a three-wheeler.

title: Railway technicians launch token strike
byline: Railway technicians and railway technician assistants have decided to launch a 24-hour token strike from this morning (26) over an overtime payment issue.

title: 5 injured in clash between SLTB and private bus employees in Polonnaruwa
byline: Five people, including a Depot Manager, have been injured and hospitalised following a clash between Sri Lanka Transport Board (SLTB) employees and private bus workers at the Polonnaruwa Bus Stand.

title: Maj Gen Dolage appointed Chief of Staff of Sri Lanka Army
byline: Major General Kapila Dolage of the Corps of Sri Lanka Engineers has been appointed as the 67th Chief of Staff of the Sri Lanka Army, with effect from today (June 26).

title: Former Health Ministry Secretary Chandragupta arrested
byline: Former Secretary to the Health Ministry Janaka Chandragupta, who arrived at the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) this morning (26) to record a statement regarding the alleged procurement of substandard drugs, has been arrested by the Bribery Commission.

title: Keheliya and 11 others indicted over substandard drug imports
byline: The Attorney General today served indictments before the Colombo High Court Special Trial-at-Bar on former Minister Keheliya Rambukwella and 11 others over the alleged import of substandard Human Immunoglobulin vials.

title: Ex-Minister Duminda Dissanayake further remanded
byline: Former Minister Duminda Dissanayake has been further remanded until July 07 by the Mount Lavinia Magistrate’s Court in relation to the case filed over the recent discovery of a gold-plated T-56 firearm at an apartment complex in Havelock Town, Colombo.

title: Health officials warn of rise in non-communicable diseases among children
byline: An increase in non-communicable diseases (NCDs) among children in the country has been observed, according to the Ministry of Health.

title: Keheliya, wife, three daughters and son-in-law indicted in High Court
byline: Indictments have been served before the Colombo High Court on former Minister Keheliya Rambukwella, his wife, three daughters and a son-in-law.

title: Govt to import 40,000MT of substitute rice to address Keeri Samba shortage
byline: The government has decided to import 40,000 metric tons of Keeri Samba and substitute rice, due to the non-availability of sufficient rice stocks in the country and to meet the demand for Keeri Samba rice, the President’s Media Division said.

title: Money laundering case against ‘Wele Suda’ to be heard in October
byline: The Colombo High Court today (26) ordered that the case filed against drug kingpin Gampola Vidanage Samantha Kumara, alias Wele Suda and another individual under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act, be taken for trial on October 10, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: Sri Lanka’s exports in 2025 surge to US$ 6.9 bn; Tea exports up while apparel and textile drop
byline: Sri Lanka’s exports in the first five months of 2025 have increased to US$ 6,933.35 million, marking a robust 7.14% growth compared to the same period in 2024, the Sri Lanka Export Development Board stated.

title: Boossa Prison inmate hospitalised after attempting to hang himself
byline: An inmate held in a special wing of the Boossa Prison, designated for high-profile criminals, has been hospitalised after allegedly attempting to hang himself this afternoon (26).

title: World Bank, ADB and JICA write to Energy Minister; raise concerns over Electricity Act amendments
byline: The Asian Development Bank (ADB), the Japan International Cooperation Agency (JICA), and the World Bank have written to Sri Lanka’s Energy Minister regarding several key issues concerning the Electricity Act 2024 Amendments published in the Gazette recently.

title: Donald Trump wants more drones and missiles in $893 billion budget request
byline: U.S. President Donald Trump wants a pay raise for troops, more high-tech missiles and drones in next year’s defense budget.

title: Former Health Secretary Janaka Chandragupta remanded
byline: Former Secretary of the Ministry of Health Janaka Chandragupta, who was arrested earlier today, has been remanded until July 8, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: SF Airlines launches all-cargo direct flight to Sri Lanka
byline: The SF Airlines today (26) commenced China’s first scheduled all-cargo direct flight to Sri Lanka.

title: UN Rights Chief calls for repealing of Sri Lanka’s Online Safety Act, moratorium on PTA
byline: United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights Volker Türk has called for the repealing of the Online Safety Act while also imposing a moratorium on enforcement of the Prevention of Terrorism Act.

title: Iran’s supreme leader, in public statement, says Iran achieved victory over Israel
byline: Iran’s Supreme Leader Ali Khamenei claimed victory over Israel on Thursday in his first public statement since a ceasefire was declared in the war between the two countries.

title: 3,426 Indians evacuated from Iran, 818 from Israel
byline: India’s Ministry of External Affairs spokesperson Randhir Jaiswal said that India, so far have evacuated 3,426 Indian nationals from Iran and 818 Indian nationals from Israel in Operation Sindhu.

title: Salt manufacturers announce measures to reduce prices
byline: Following discussions and an agreement reached with the Consumer Affairs Authority (CAA), the Salt Manufacturers’ Association of Sri Lanka has announced several measures to reduce the price of salt in the consumer market.

title: Ex-President Ranil named as witness in case against Keheliya
byline: Former President Ranil Wickremesinghe and several former Cabinet Ministers have been named as witnesses in the case against former Minister of Health Keheliya Rambukwella over the alleged import of substandard Human Immunoglobulin vials, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: ASPI records new all-time high
byline: The All Share Price Index (ASPI) of the Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) closed at an all-time high after gaining over 200 points today.

title: UN Rights Chief assures support for SL’s program to ensure national unity and reconciliation
byline: The United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights, Volker Türk has stated that he supports the program currently being carried out by President Anura Kumara Dissanayake and the government of Sri Lanka to ensure national unity and reconciliation and to safeguard human rights, the President’s Media Division said in a statement.

title: Special notice regarding three job categories in Israel’s construction sector
byline: The registration for three categories of jobs in Israel’s construction sector has been temporarily suspended, the Sri Lanka Foreign Employment Bureau (SLBFE) has announced.

title: Abdul Wazeeth to fill vacant SLMC National List MP seat
byline: The Sri Lanka Muslim Congress has decided to nominate Abdul Wazeeth to fill the vacancy created in Parliament following the resignation of Mohamed Sali Naleem in March.

title: Global financial crime watchdog calls for action on crypto risks
byline: The Financial Action Task Force (FATF), a global financial crime watchdog, on Thursday called on countries to take stronger action to combat illicit finance in crypto assets, warning that gaps in regulation could have global repercussions.

title: Iran will respond strongly if attacked by Israel: Iranian Ambassador
byline: Iran will respond strongly if Israel launches fresh attacks amidst the ceasefire between the two nations, according to Iranian Ambassador to Sri Lanka, Dr. Alireza Delkhosh.
